intro: Boopis sanjuanina, commonly known as San Juan flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its life cycle is annual, with seeds dispersed by wind, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
